intro: Lepicaune sibirica, commonly known as the Siberian lepicaune, is a rare flowering plant native to the cold regions of Siberia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate to subarctic climates. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, and it blooms during the short summer season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
